text: meta.json replaces meta.jsonl: single JSON file per node, RMW under flock (LOCK_SH read, LOCK_EX write), atomic write via .json.tmp + rename
meta.json structure: {token_budget, last_reviewed, last_bullet_checkpoint, bullets: {id: {useful, harmful, used}}}
migrate legacy meta.jsonl on first access: read all lines, merge into meta.json structure, delete legacy file after successful write
only the inotify watcher writes to SQLite — CLI commands (kg add, kg review) write JSONL only [kg-stop-hook]
kg start creates <project>/.claude -> .kg symlink (ensure_dot_claude_symlink) — same pattern as mg .claude -> .memory_graph; lets Claude Code find local settings/commands in .kg/
legacy meta.jsonl files auto-deleted after migration to meta.json — _migrate_legacy_meta() calls legacy.unlink() after writing meta.json
MCP server uses FastMCP (mcp.run()). Registered with --root <project_root> arg so server finds kg.toml regardless of invocation cwd. Server name 'kg'.
kg start creates <project>/.claude → .kg symlink (same pattern as mg's .claude → .memory_graph). Lets Claude Code discover skills/settings in .kg/ when running inside the project dir.

vote_score() Beta prior: (useful + alpha) / (useful + harmful*harmful_weight + alpha + beta). Defaults: alpha=2, beta=2, harmful_weight=2 (neutral=0.5, harmful counts double). Rank multiplier = score*2.0 so neutral→1.0x.
memory_context MCP tool tracks _seen_slugs process-wide; subsequent calls filter already-seen nodes (differential context). fresh=True resets, existing=[...] seeds from caller. Matches mg pattern.

cfg.kg_dir property missing from KGConfig — install.py ensure_dot_claude_symlink uses cfg.kg_dir.resolve() but only index_dir.parent exists as a local var. Fix: add @property kg_dir returning self.index_dir.parent
kg create <slug> <title> [--type]: creates node with explicit title (defaults to slug in kg add). Idempotent — exits 0 if already exists. Needed for daily notes nodes like 'Notes 2026-02-20'.
.claude → .kg symlink: kg start calls ensure_dot_claude_symlink(cfg) to create <project_root>/.claude → .kg. Lets Claude Code find skills/settings at .kg/ when working in the project.
cfg.kg_dir property missing from KGConfig: install.py references cfg.kg_dir but it's not defined — workaround is cfg.index_dir.parent. PENDING: add @property kg_dir to KGConfig.

local embeddings: model = "fastembed:BAAI/bge-small-en-v1.5" in [embeddings] — no API key needed, pip install fastembed, 384-dim ONNX. Prefix "gemini:" for Gemini, "fastembed:" or bare name for local.
embedding failure transparency: _embed_node warns to stderr on exception (no silent contextlib.suppress); vector_server exits at startup if Gemini model + no GEMINI_API_KEY/GOOGLE_API_KEY
inotify-simple gated to sys_platform=="linux" in pyproject.toml — inotify is Linux-only; watcher falls back to polling on macOS/Windows. Bare dep without marker causes install failure on non-Linux.
pyproject.toml core deps: click, diskcache, fastembed, fastmcp, google-genai, inotify-simple (linux only), numpy, rich. No separate optional extras needed — all embedding/watch deps are in core.

fastcdc vendored as src/kg/_vendor/fastcdc/ package: __init__.py tries Cython (fastcdc_cy.pyx → .so), falls back to pure Python (fastcdc_py.py). setup.py with BuildExtWithFallback ensures graceful fallback when Cython unavailable.
pyproject.toml build backend: setuptools (not hatchling) when using Cython extensions. Requires build-system = {requires=[setuptools>=61.0, wheel, cython>=3.0], build-backend=setuptools.build_meta}.
fastcdc chunk sizes: kg uses avg=1500B (min=375B, max=12000B) for FTS-based search; mg uses avg=4096B for LLM context windows. Intentional difference — smaller chunks improve FTS recall.
(gotcha) fastcdc_cy returns an iterator (generator), not a list — calling len() on its result fails. file_indexer only iterates chunks, so compatible. Don't call len() directly on fastcdc output.
kg status validates kg.toml at runtime: embeddings (gemini:/fastembed:/openai: prefix + API key presence), sources (path exists, git repo check when use_git=true) — shows Config row with kg.toml path

watcher SIGHUP hot-reload: _reload_state=[False] mutable container (avoids PLW0603 global); SIGHUP handler sets [0]=True; loop checks after each inotify timeout (5s) or poll cycle (1s); raises _ReloadRequestedError; run_from_config loops to re-read kg.toml
kg reload command: sends SIGHUP to watcher via PID file (os.kill(pid, SIGHUP)) or supervisord (supervisorctl signal HUP kg-watcher). Watcher reloads within 1-5s without restart.

embedding model prefixes in kg.toml [embeddings].model: gemini:* (cloud, needs GEMINI_API_KEY/GOOGLE_API_KEY), openai:* (cloud, needs OPENAI_API_KEY), fastembed:* or bare name (local, no key). Unknown prefix warns in kg status.
Rich markup gotcha: [[sources]] in a table cell is parsed as markup (unknown tag stripped). Fix: rich.markup.escape('[[sources]]') for literal display, or use \[ escaping.

ruff N818: Exception subclass names must end with 'Error' suffix (e.g. _ReloadRequestedError not _ReloadRequested). ruff PLW0603: 'global' to mutate module var is discouraged — use mutable container like list[bool] instead.
